00001 class rule_generator:
00002     def __init__(self, p, sid_start):
00003         " Make sure p points to wherever the blacklist is located (directory). SIDs for rules have to be unique, so initiate the generator with an acceptable starting rule number. "
00004         
00005         self.path = p
00006         self.sid = sid_start
00007 
00008     def block(self, _atom):
00009         """ Takes an atom and writes a rule to block future instances """
00010         
00011         if not _atom:
00012             print "Empty atom"
00013             return None
00014         else:
00015             (timestamp, destination, port, protocol) = _atom
00016             rules_file = "blacklist"
00017             f = open(self.path + "/blacklist", "a")
00018             rule = "\nblock " + protocol + " $HOME_NET any <> " + destination + "." + port + " (sid:" + str(self.sid) + ")"
00019             f.write(rule)
00020             f.close()
00021             self.sid = self.sid + 1
00022             return rule
